title: President Donald J. Trump Signs H.R. 1037, H.R. 3834 and H.R. 6870 into Law – The White House
content:
Statements & Releases			

		Law & Justice	

Issued on:
November 3, 2018
On Saturday, November 3, 2018, the President signed into law:H.R. 1037, which authorizes the National Emergency Medical Services Memorial Foundation to establish a commemorative work with regard to emergency medical services in the District of Columbia and its environs;H.R. 3834, the “9/11 Heroes Medal of Valor Act of 2017,” which expands eligibility to receive the 9/11 Heroes Medal of Valor to public safety officers who participated in the response to the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001 and died as a result of a related health condition; andH.R. 6870, which renames the Stop Trading on Congressional Knowledge Act of 2012 in honor of Representative Louise McIntosh Slaughter.
